ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

Let me ask you some questions about your relative: Would you say that you know/knew him/her well?
When was the last time you had any contact with him/her?
Is your relative deceased?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: using alcohol in larger amounts or over a longer period than s/he intended?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: being unable to stop or cut down on drinking?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: spending a lot of time drinking or being hungover?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: being unable to work, go to school or take care of household responsibilities?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: being high from drinking when s/he could get hurt?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: having accidental injuries?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: reducing or giving up normal activities?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: objections from family or friends, or at work or school?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: having a legal problem (DWIs, arrests)?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: having blackouts?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: going on binges or benders, drinking 2 or more days without sobering up?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: physical health problems (liver disease, pancreatitis)?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: emotional or psychological problems (uninterested, depressed, suspicious)?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: withdrawal symptoms (shakes, seizures/convulsions, DTs)?

Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: needing to drink a great deal more in order to get an effect, or finding that s/he could no longer get drunk on the amount s/he used to drink?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: any kind of treatment or hospitalization?

Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: making rules to control drinking (never drinking alone, never drinking before 5pm), drinking before breakfast, or drinking non-beverage alcohol like vanilla extract, cough syrup or rubbing alcohol?
Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: trouble at work or school or getting into fights while drinking?

Because of drinking, did your (relative) ever have problems such as: losing friends because of his/her drinking, considering him/herself an excessive drinker, or feeling guilty about his/her drinking?
Did (relative) have a period of a month or more when 3 or more of these experiences occurred together?
How old was (relative) the first/last time he/she had three or more of these experiences occurring within a period lasting a month or longer? Age of onset
How old was (relative) the first/last time he/she had three or more of these experiences occurring within a period lasting a month or longer? Age resolved
